result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen Lorraine Surgeon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Karen Lorraine Surgeon in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.

BTC: Finding of guilt as to count 1 as amended to 3 counts of misd Retail Theft; DRI count 2. Credit for time served, pay court cost, payment plan of $50 a month starting January 1, 2016 ftp 10 days Racine County Jail.
